moves.1. e4: Opens Diagonals to Queen And Bishop
moves.1... d5: immediately challenges White's weak pawn that is not undefended by no pieces.
moves.2. exd5: white challenges my intention to take with the queen so white maybe gets lead in development in exchange for weaker center
moves.2... Nf6: I am willing to sacrifice an pawn to commit White to weakening the structure of the pawns and I will get a lead in development and take advantage of White's horrible position
moves.3. Nf3: white does not want any of that so just develops
moves.3... Qxd5: I have a better center and more solid pawn structure, but White can attack my queen with Nc3 or c4 after d4
moves.4... Bg4: I develop aggressively and cause White to struggle, usually it is Black who struggles, not White
moves.5. O-O: White castles into a devastating attack
moves.5... Nc6: getting another re-enforcement to the kingside
moves.6. d3: I'm not sure if White can recover, but maybe his dark-squared bishop can help his position in shambles
moves.6... O-O-O: developing incredibly aggressively, White has no chance.
moves.7. Bg5: White tries to get the dark-squared bishop to help the situation but he only loses the valuable re-enforcement
moves.7... Bxf3: BRILLIANCY ALERT GENIUS ALERT KING ALERT PROPHET ALERT!!!!! I have captured the defender of the bishop, now White might be scratching his head wondering how he is left with a deficit, not understanding that some people are just on another level
moves.8... Qxg5: BOOM!!!! now I have extra knight
moves.9. Bxc6: takes to weaken my pawn structure, but it does not matter, I win
moves.9... bxc6: no pieces to attack exposed king
moves.10. Nc3: I have extra dark-squares bishop and I use it to attack the h2 square and win the game
moves.11. a3: maybe white thought I was going after c3 knight so he stops my move
moves.11... Bd6: but he doesn't see that his kingside is lost
moves.12. g3: blocks my bishop's path to the strong
moves.12... h5: getting another re-enforcement to attack the weak
moves.13. Ne4: trades but to no avail I win not complex but obvious
moves.14... Bxg3: and reveals the rook to the queen so White does not take my bishop
moves.17... Rh6: aiming Rook g6 to win the queen
moves.19... Qxh2+: I was getting really sick tired of white missing my attacks so I just trade queens to make win more obvious
moves.21. Kxh2: I lost the extra bishop but I have pawns to win
moves.21... Rd2+: rook to d2 check attacks c2 and x-ray b2
moves.22... Rgg2: I win with awfully awesome process
moves.27... h4: now I threaten mate and I win
moves.28... Rg3#: ALERT I JUST PASSED THE BRILLIANCY TEST I HAVE BEEN PROMOTED TO CHANCELLOR
